title: Constant let binding slower than const

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: C-enhancement

labels.name: T-compiler

body:
Hello.
I am currently optimizing my [`des`](https://crates.io/crates/des) crate and I found out that using a `let` statement can be significantly slower than using a `const` statement.

For instance, when I run `cargo bench` with the `const` declaration [here](https://github.com/antoyo/des-rs/blob/97031b96ebb2534a8b0bb9cf3cc675048fb0d742/src/lib.rs#L258), I get:

```
running 1 test
test bench_decrypt ... bench:       1,621 ns/iter (+/- 15)
```

If I replace this `const` by a `let`, the performance is not as good:

```
running 1 test
test bench_decrypt ... bench:      18,203 ns/iter (+/- 99)
```

On another benchmark, I think it was 4 times slower with `let`.

I expected to have the same performance with a constant `let` and a `const`.

Instead, the `let` declaration is slower than a `const`.
